did.abstract: The items include an indenture of apprenticeship, binding Samuel Booth (1818-1894) to Elias Combs as a house carpenter, dated 1835, and a letter from Samuel B. Chittenden to Mayor Samuel Booth, offering money to finance a civic reception Honoring General Philip Sheridan, dated 1867.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: Samuel Booth (1818-1894) was a carpenter and Mayor of Brooklyn from 1866 to 1867.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Samuel Booth papers consist of 2 items dated 1835 and 1867. The items include an indenture of apprenticeship, binding Samuel Booth to Elias Combs as a house carpenter, dated 1835, and a letter from Samuel B. Chittenden to Mayor Samuel Booth, offering money to finance a civic reception Honoring General Philip Sheridan, dated 1867.
